docs.abstract: Digital comics. New apps. More interactivity. Here’s what technology has done to the comic books industry.
docs.snippet: Digital comics. New apps. More interactivity. Here’s what technology has done to the comic books industry.
docs.lead_paragraph: How do New York Times journalists use technology in their jobs and in their personal lives? George Gene Gustines, a senior editor in graphics and video who also writes about comic books, discussed the tech he’s using.

headline.main: How Technology Transforms the World of Comic Books
headline.print_headline: Digital Enhances the Comic Book Experience

docs.abstract: Jennifer Salke, the new head of the tech giant’s TV and movie division, is letting Hollywood know that the door is open for creative talent to find a home at Amazon.
docs.snippet: Jennifer Salke, the new head of the tech giant’s TV and movie division, is letting Hollywood know that the door is open for creative talent to find a home at Amazon.
docs.lead_paragraph: CULVER CITY, Calif. — Jennifer Salke has been the head of Amazon’s television and movie division for four months. Her sunny corner office at Culver Studios, a historic movie lot that now serves as Amazon’s entertainment headquarters, has not yet been fully put together. She is still getting to know some staff members in the film department.

headline.main: Amazon Studios’ New Boss Is Reshaping Its Strategy. Step One: Lure New Talent.
headline.print_headline: Amazon Studios’ New Boss Says Door Is Open to Talent

byline.original: By Brooks Barnes and John Koblin

docs.abstract: Mr. Trump is deliberately undermining faith in the American press corps. Other countries are taking note.
docs.snippet: Mr. Trump is deliberately undermining faith in the American press corps. Other countries are taking note.
docs.lead_paragraph: Many people, including many Republican lawmakers, dismiss President Trump’s attacks on The Washington Post, CNN and other news organizations as just one of those crazy — but ultimately harmless — things he does to blow off steam. They’re wrong.

headline.main: The True Damage of Trump’s ‘Fake News’
headline.print_headline: Mr. Trump’s War on the Truth

docs.abstract: More than two dozen civil rights organizations asked the tech giant to stop selling its image recognition system to law enforcement agencies.
docs.snippet: More than two dozen civil rights organizations asked the tech giant to stop selling its image recognition system to law enforcement agencies.
docs.lead_paragraph: SEATTLE — In late 2016, Amazon introduced a new online service that could help identify faces and other objects in images, offering it to anyone at a low cost through its giant cloud computing division, Amazon Web Services.

headline.main: Amazon Pushes Facial Recognition to Police. Critics See Surveillance Risk.
headline.print_headline: A.C.L.U. Sees ‘a Grave Threat’ In Amazon’s Facial Recognition

docs.abstract: The retailer is now making its own server chips. It’s the latest sign that big internet outfits are willing to cut out longtime suppliers.
docs.snippet: The retailer is now making its own server chips. It’s the latest sign that big internet outfits are willing to cut out longtime suppliers.
docs.lead_paragraph: Amazon, the world’s largest online retailer and largest cloud-computing company, is pushing into a new line of work: computer chips.

headline.main: Amazon’s Homegrown Chips Threaten Silicon Valley Giant Intel
headline.print_headline: Amazon Puts Heat on Intel In Tiny Leap

docs.abstract: Even during a year of division and fear of the future in many corners of America, the Fixes column found people trying to make things better — and succeeding.

docs.abstract: How privacy, security and employee protests will shape the year ahead for Silicon Valley.
docs.snippet: How privacy, security and employee protests will shape the year ahead for Silicon Valley.
docs.lead_paragraph: If you thought 2018 was a bad year for tech, 2019 might turn out to be even worse. This year was filled with revelations about privacy, security and cyberwarfare. Next year, the consequences of those revelations will unfold. And we should be very worried about what the future holds.

headline.main: The 3 Biggest Challenges for Tech in 2019
